08077.intro: Mesa County starter findings (customize this box as you expand the full HNA).
bullets: Use the county-wide snapshot as context, but add municipality breakouts (Grand Junction, Fruita, Palisade) to avoid averaging away neighborhood issues.
Add HUD CHAS to quantify cost burden by AMI band (0–30 / 30–50 / 50–80 / 80–100 / 100%+) and size the “units needed” distribution.
Add a pipeline section: permits/starts/completions and vacancy trends to interpret whether affordability stress is supply-driven, demand-driven, or both.
Map overlays to prioritize geographies: LIHTC inventory, QCT/DDA, transit access, jobs, and hazard constraints.
